title: Social Media Utilization Strategies for Ethical Practice in Social Work

context.prior_knowledge: Foundational social welfare theory and practical field experience
context.additional_context: Cultivating ethical decision-making skills applicable to real workplace scenarios through asynchronous collaborative learning in smartphone-centric limited-technology environments

learning_goals: Learners will be able to identify and explain at least three ethical dilemmas that may arise when using social media.
Through virtual case simulations, learners will analyze ethical issues and propose solutions aligned with expert standards.
Learners will engage in collaborative learning on a closed mobile platform and establish practical guidelines based on peer feedback from colleagues.

resources: Closed Facebook Group or Mobile Collaboration Tool
constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
